too_small.text: Auth We generally recommend using the new @supabase/ssr package instead of auth-helpers. @supabase/ssr takes the core concepts of the Auth Helpers package and makes them available to any server framework. Check out the [migration doc](/docs/guides/auth/server-side/migrating-to-ssr-from-auth-helpers) to learn more. See legacy docs

headers.h1: Supabase Auth with the Next.js App Router

too_small.text: Auth The auth-helpers package has been replaced with the @supabase/ssr package. We recommend setting up Auth for your Next.js app with @supabase/ssr instead. See the [Next.js Server-Side Auth guide](/docs/guides/auth/server-side/nextjs) to learn how. See legacy docs

headers.h1: Supabase Auth with Next.js Pages Directory

too_small.text: Auth The auth-helpers package has been replaced with the @supabase/ssr package. We recommend setting up Auth for your Next.js app with @supabase/ssr instead. See the [Next.js Server-Side Auth guide](/docs/guides/auth/server-side/nextjs?router=pages) to learn how. See legacy docs

Auth
Supabase Auth supports building enterprise applications that require Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication [with SAML 2.0](/docs/guides/auth/sso/auth-sso-saml).
